required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate Protein C Levels in Severe Sepsis Patients on Drotrecogin Alfa (Activated)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Study to Evaluate Dose and Duration of Treatment of Drotrecogin Alfa (Activated) Using Serial Measurements of Protein C in Patients With Severe Sepsis and Multiple Organ Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock:
In this trial, patients with severe sepsis and low protein C levels will receive drotrecogin alfa (activated) at the normal, approved dose and time of administration [24 microgram/kilogram/hour (mcg/kg/hour) for 96 hours] or will receive the normal, approved dose or higher doses than the approved dose for a longer administration time. After the drug administration is complete, the protein C levels from the patients receiving the normal, approved dose will be compared to protein C levels from patients receiving the normal, approved dose or higher dose for a longer duration to determine if the protein C levels improve faster if given higher dose and/or longer administration time.
Note: The protocol was amended to remove the option of shorter infusion durations.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Protein C Levels From Day 1 to Day 7
primary_outcome.description: Mean change in protein C from Study Day 1 to Study Day 7 was tested using an unadjusted two-sample t-test with a two-sided alpha of 0.05. To be included in the primary analysis, Intention-to-Treat (ITT) patients must have at least 1 protein C value available at 24 hours or earlier and at least 1 protein C value at a post-24-hour timepoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Protein C Level From Study Day 1 to Study Day 7 in Patients With Moderate and Severe Protein C Deficiency
secondary_outcome.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: A protein C level greater than half the lower limit of normal. Severe Protein C Deficiency: A protein C level less than or equal to half the lower limit of normal.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 to hospital discharge or Day 90

secondary_outcome.measure: 28-Day Time Averaged Sequential Organ Failure (SOFA) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The presence of 5 organ dysfunctions (cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, hepatic, coagulation) was assessed using a Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score. Each organ has a possible dysfunction score of 0 to 4, for a total SOFA score range of 0 (no organ dysfunction) to 20 (all organs with dysfunction). SOFA scores were time-averaged.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAE) and Serious Bleeding Events (SBE) by Time Period
secondary_outcome.description: Serious bleeding events (SBE): intracranial hemorrhage, life-threatening or fatal bleed, or bleeding event assessed as an SAE. Patients may have multiple events with onset in different time periods. SAEs include SBEs. The 3 SBEs in Alternative-Moderate Deficiency arm (days 5-8) occurred after completion of study drug infusion. One event (pleural haemorrhage) occurred same day of completion of infusion and 2 events (cerebral haemorrhage, shock haemorrhagic) occurred day after completion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality by Protein C Normalized Versus Not-normalized
secondary_outcome.description: Normalization was defined as having 2 consecutive protein C measurements above the lower limit of normal through Study Day 7.

arm_group.description: 24 microgram/kilogram/hour (mcg/kg/hr) for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours
24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 48 to 144 hours (original protocol) or an additional 72 to 144 hours (amended protocol)
24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for 48 to 144 hours (original protocol) or an additional 72 to 144 hours (amended protocol)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be 18 years or older
- Must have a suspected or proven infection
- Must have two or more sepsis-associated organ dysfunctions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Documented multiple organ dysfunction greater than 24 hours prior to start of study drug
- Actual body weight less than 30 kg or more than 135 kg
- Platelet count less than 30,000/mm^3
- Active internal bleeding or at increased risk of bleeding
- Not expected to survive 28 days given the patient's pre-existing uncorrectable medical condition

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Efficacy results are only provided for the intent-to-treat (ITT) population (patients who actually received the randomized treatment after the 24 hour pretreatment period).

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy
group.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours Severe Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours

group.title: Randomized Non-ITT Population
group.description: Participants were randomized to either the Standard or Alternative Therapy and received 24 mcg/kg/hr during the first 24 hours (common therapy period); however, they did not continue on to receive the actual randomized therapy.

participants_list.participants: 51 severe protein C deficiency; 176 moderate protein C deficiency
33 severe protein C deficiency; 173 moderate protein C deficiency
51 severe protein C deficiency; 173 moderate protein C deficiency
33 severe protein C deficiency; 172 moderate protein C deficiency

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy
group.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours Severe Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Recent Surgery
measure.description: Recent surgery was defined as an intervention performed under general or regional anesthesia that had some relationship to the present sepsis episode within 30 days of study entry.

measure.title: Number of organ dysfunctions
measure.description: Cardiovascular: systolic blood pressure (SBP) 90 mmHg or mean arterial pressure (MAP) 70 mmHg for >1 hour despite fluid resuscitation (FR), adequate intravascular volume, or vasopressors to maintain SBP 90 mmHg or MAP70 mmHg; Renal: average output <0.5 mL/kg/hr for 1 hr despite FR; Respiratory: Pressure of Arterial Oxygen (O2) to Fractional Inspired O2 (PaO2/FiO2) 250; Hematology: platelet count <80,000/mm^3 or 50% decrease in count from highest over 3 days prior to study; Unexplained acidosis: pH7.3 or base deficit 5.0 mEq/L AND plasma lactate level >1.5 times upper limit of normal.

measure.title: Time of onset of Second organ dysfunction to start of drug infusion
measure.description: Mean time between the onset of a second organ dysfunction (cardiovascular, renal, respiratory, hematology, and unexplained metabolic acidosis) to the start of study drug infusion.

measure.title: Total Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score
measure.description: The presence of 5 organ dysfunctions (cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, hepatic, coagulation) was assessed using a Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score. Each organ has a possible dysfunction score of 0 to 4, for a total SOFA score range of 0 (no organ dysfunction) to 20 (all organs with dysfunction).

measure.title: Acute Physiology And Chronic Health Evaluation (APACHE) II Score
measure.description: Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II. A classification system that assessed a patients severity of disease based on 12 physiologic measurements, age, and previous health status. Total scores range from 0 to 71. A higher score indicates increasing severity of disease and a greater likelihood of mortality.

measure.title: Central laboratory protein C class
measure.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: A protein C level greater than half the lower limit of normal. Severe Protein C Deficiency: A protein C level less than or equal to half the lower limit of normal.

outcome.title: Mean Change in Protein C Levels From Day 1 to Day 7
outcome.description: Mean change in protein C from Study Day 1 to Study Day 7 was tested using an unadjusted two-sample t-test with a two-sided alpha of 0.05. To be included in the primary analysis, Intention-to-Treat (ITT) patients must have at least 1 protein C value available at 24 hours or earlier and at least 1 protein C value at a post-24-hour timepoint.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) population.

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy
group.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours Severe Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours

measure.title: Mean Change in Protein C Levels From Day 1 to Day 7
measure.description: Mean change in protein C from Study Day 1 to Study Day 7 was tested using an unadjusted two-sample t-test with a two-sided alpha of 0.05. To be included in the primary analysis, Intention-to-Treat (ITT) patients must have at least 1 protein C value available at 24 hours or earlier and at least 1 protein C value at a post-24-hour timepoint.
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) population.

class.title: Change in Protein C, Day 1 to Day 7, n=221, n=202

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for change to Day 7

outcome.title: Mean Change in Protein C Level From Study Day 1 to Study Day 7 in Patients With Moderate and Severe Protein C Deficiency
outcome.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: A protein C level greater than half the lower limit of normal. Severe Protein C Deficiency: A protein C level less than or equal to half the lower limit of normal.
outcome.population: ITT moderately deficient population, ITT severely deficient population

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy
group.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours Severe Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours

measure.title: Mean Change in Protein C Level From Study Day 1 to Study Day 7 in Patients With Moderate and Severe Protein C Deficiency
measure.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: A protein C level greater than half the lower limit of normal. Severe Protein C Deficiency: A protein C level less than or equal to half the lower limit of normal.
measure.population: ITT moderately deficient population, ITT severely deficient population

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for the moderate Protein C Deficiency (difference in change of pc between alt and standard groups)
p-value is for the severe Protein C Deficiency (difference in change of pc between alt and standard groups)

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy

outcome.title: Hospital Mortality (up to Day 90)

outcome.description: The presence of 5 organ dysfunctions (cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, hepatic, coagulation) was assessed using a Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score. Each organ has a possible dysfunction score of 0 to 4, for a total SOFA score range of 0 (no organ dysfunction) to 20 (all organs with dysfunction). SOFA scores were time-averaged.

measure.description: The presence of 5 organ dysfunctions (cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, hepatic, coagulation) was assessed using a Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score. Each organ has a possible dysfunction score of 0 to 4, for a total SOFA score range of 0 (no organ dysfunction) to 20 (all organs with dysfunction). SOFA scores were time-averaged.

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for total SOFA difference between alternative and standard therapy
p-value is for difference in cardiovascular SOFA between alternative and standard therapy
p-value is for difference in respiratory SOFA between alternative and standard therapy
p-value is for difference in renal SOFA between alternative and standard therapy
p-value is for difference in hematology SOFA between alternative and standard therapy
p-value is for difference in liver SOFA between alternative and standard therapy

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAE) and Serious Bleeding Events (SBE) by Time Period
outcome.description: Serious bleeding events (SBE): intracranial hemorrhage, life-threatening or fatal bleed, or bleeding event assessed as an SAE. Patients may have multiple events with onset in different time periods. SAEs include SBEs. The 3 SBEs in Alternative-Moderate Deficiency arm (days 5-8) occurred after completion of study drug infusion. One event (pleural haemorrhage) occurred same day of completion of infusion and 2 events (cerebral haemorrhage, shock haemorrhagic) occurred day after completion.
outcome.population: Randomized participants who received randomized therapy (intention to treat population).

group.title: Standard Therapy - Severe Deficiency
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Standard Therapy - Moderate Deficiency
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy - Severe Deficiency
group.description: Severe Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy - Moderate Deficiency
group.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours

measure.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAE) and Serious Bleeding Events (SBE) by Time Period
measure.description: Serious bleeding events (SBE): intracranial hemorrhage, life-threatening or fatal bleed, or bleeding event assessed as an SAE. Patients may have multiple events with onset in different time periods. SAEs include SBEs. The 3 SBEs in Alternative-Moderate Deficiency arm (days 5-8) occurred after completion of study drug infusion. One event (pleural haemorrhage) occurred same day of completion of infusion and 2 events (cerebral haemorrhage, shock haemorrhagic) occurred day after completion.
measure.population: Randomized participants who received randomized therapy (intention to treat population).
measure.units: number of patients with at least 1 event

Serious Bleeding Events: Study Days 5 through 8
Serious Bleeding Events: Study Days 9 through 28

outcome.title: Mortality by Protein C Normalized Versus Not-normalized
outcome.description: Normalization was defined as having 2 consecutive protein C measurements above the lower limit of normal through Study Day 7.
outcome.population: ITT Population - All patients who are randomly assigned to treatment and receive any amount of randomized therapy

measure.title: Mortality by Protein C Normalized Versus Not-normalized
measure.description: Normalization was defined as having 2 consecutive protein C measurements above the lower limit of normal through Study Day 7.
measure.population: ITT Population - All patients who are randomly assigned to treatment and receive any amount of randomized therapy

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for difference between participants normalizing protein C and not normalizing protein C.

outcome.title: Mortality for Severe Protein C Deficiency
outcome.description: Twenty-eight day mortality is the patient's mortality status at the predefined timepoint of 672 hours from the start of study drug infusion. Hospital mortality is the patient's survival status at the end of the hospital stay or study day 90 (if the patient remains in the hospital).
outcome.population: ITT Population - All patients who are randomly assigned to treatment and receive any amount of randomized therapy. ITT patients with severe protein C deficiency. Severe deficiency is defined by the 24-hour local laboratory protein C value reported to the Interactive voice response system (IVRS).

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy
group.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours Severe Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours

measure.title: Mortality for Severe Protein C Deficiency
measure.description: Twenty-eight day mortality is the patient's mortality status at the predefined timepoint of 672 hours from the start of study drug infusion. Hospital mortality is the patient's survival status at the end of the hospital stay or study day 90 (if the patient remains in the hospital).
measure.population: ITT Population - All patients who are randomly assigned to treatment and receive any amount of randomized therapy. ITT patients with severe protein C deficiency. Severe deficiency is defined by the 24-hour local laboratory protein C value reported to the Interactive voice response system (IVRS).

analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for 28-Day Mortality, Dead at Day 28 vs. Alive at Day 28

outcome.title: Mortality for Moderate Protein C Deficiency by Infusion Duration
outcome.population: ITT Population - ITT Switch-No Population, ITT patients who did not answer yes to the switch question.

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours

group.title: Alternative Therapy
group.description: Moderate Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours Severe Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours

measure.title: Mortality for Moderate Protein C Deficiency by Infusion Duration
measure.population: ITT Population - ITT Switch-No Population, ITT patients who did not answer yes to the switch question.

group.title: Standard Therapy
group.description: Participants assigned to standard therapy (24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 hours) who received any amount of study drug.

group.title: Alternative Therapy
group.description: Participants assigned to alternative therapy (Moderate Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 24 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours Severe Protein C Deficiency: 24 mcg/kg/hr for 24 hours, followed by 30 or 36 mcg/kg/hr for an additional 72 to 144 hours) who received any amount of study drug.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Fewer patients than planned had severe PC deficiency so only 2 higher doses were tested & fewer required longer infusions so a large proportion of alternative therapy patients in effect received standard therapy making treatment comparisons difficult
